description: Borrowed from German Plankton, coined by Viktor Hensen and derived from Ancient Greek πλαγκτός (planktós, “drifter”), from πλάζω (plázō, “I turn aside, wander”).

nouns.description: plankton (usually uncountable, plural planktons or plankton)

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Organisms, especially small and microscopic ones, that drift in water.
(uncountable) A plankter, any single organism that drifts in water.
